intro: Calycadenia cephalotes, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada rayflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh, dry conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from white to pink. Calycadenia cephalotes is known for its resilience and is of interest to botanists studying xerophytic adaptations.
